name: Add new SFTP user.txt - Locations
description: This section explains how SFTP locations are configured to grant access permissions to users. It defines a JSON object with a key 'sib-internal-push' that represents an SFTP location. The 'bucket' and 'path' keys specify the S3 bucket and folder path where files can be accessed. The 'permissions' key determines whether the user has read ('get') or write ('put') access to that location. The actual values for these configurations are defined in a separate file called 'variables.tf'. Additionally, it shows how the 'actions' variable maps the 'get' and 'put' permissions to specific S3 actions.
use_cases: Granting read-only access to specific S3 locations for SFTP users
Granting write access to specific S3 locations for SFTP users
Configuring multiple SFTP locations with different access permissions
Centralizing the configuration of SFTP location permissions in a separate file
capabilities: Mapping of permissions to S3 actions

name: Add new SFTP user.txt - Users
description: This section explains how to add a new SFTP user with specific permissions to access certain locations (paths) in an S3 bucket. It provides an example of how to define a new module for an SFTP user called 'sib-internal' with access to the 'sib-internal-push' location. The user's public SSH key is also specified in the module configuration.
use_cases: Adding a new SFTP user with access to specific S3 locations
Granting permissions to an SFTP user for uploading or downloading files to/from specific S3 paths
Managing SFTP user access and permissions using Terraform modules
capabilities: Granular access control for S3 locations
Terraform module for SFTP user configuration
SSH public key authentication for SFTP users
Defining user permissions based on S3 locations

name: Add new SFTP user.txt - PS
description: This section discusses the potential for automating the process of granting SFTP user permissions at Razorpay. It suggests that users should be able to request access by specifying the 'locations' they need access to, and the rest of the fields should be handled automatically. This could streamline the process of managing SFTP user permissions and reduce manual effort.
use_cases: Automating the process of granting SFTP user permissions
Allowing users to request access by specifying required 'locations'
Automating the handling of other fields related to SFTP user permissions
Streamlining the management of SFTP user permissions
capabilities: Automated field handling for user permissions
